newsitem.title: FINLAND: Helsinki seen powering ahead on Nokia, Wall Street.
newsitem.headline: Helsinki seen powering ahead on Nokia, Wall Street.

text.p: Sharp gains in Nokia and in U.S. stocks overnight were seen taking Finnish shares broadly up on Friday, brokers said.
"We could add almost two percent," one broker said.
Nokia closed at about 315.75 markka in New York on Thursday, up from 307.50 in Helsinki.

Shares in consumer goods group Fiskars were expected to be strong after announcing higher 1996 earnings and a bonus dividend. German car maker Porsche's confirmation that it would build 5,000 cars in Finland with Valmet was seen helping Valmet ahead.
Tone was upbeat, bolstered by positive domestic news and by U.S. Federal Reserve governor Alan Greenspan's soothing comments on Thursday, brokers said.
The Fed chief gave little reason to believe that the central bank was considering raising interest rates at the February 4 and 5 meetings.
Brokers were waiting for mobile phone maker Benefon's and oven maker Tulikivi's 1996 reports due to be released later on Friday.
